intro: Tontelea laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered tontelea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Tontelea laxiflora is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforest understory.
